55
understanding in areas which were not always easy to define. The mutual
respect, understanding and friendships which, we believe, have resulted,
are a dividend which we also greatly cherish for we feel we are all equally
dedicated to the same high ideals . We have attempted to administer those
grants we have received with responsibility and integrity. We are proud of
the record we have been able to register so far, and of the standards set for
the future. We hope the Foundation may, in some small measure, share our
enthusiasm and pride, and that posterity will find these efforts, however
imperfect, to be significant to American education and democracy in our day.
Our most sincere thanks.
Respectfully submitted
on behalf of the NAEB
Board of Directors, and
NAEB President William G. Harley
Harry J. Skornia
Executive Director
March, 1959
HEH/HJS/rs
